member.summary: Public property for the error code that this exception contains. This can be an internal error code (warning from 0x000 through 0x7FF, actual errors 0x800 through 0x1000) or it can be an interface-DLL related error as defined in the ErrorCodes class

member.summary: Attocube.API defined error codes

member.name: M:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.IsWarning(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines that this error code is really "only" a warning -> do not throw an exception, just return response as is
member.returns: True, if this error code is simply a warning - false if not

member.summary: Determines that this error code truly is an error that necessitates throwing an exception
member.returns: True, if this error code is in fact a "real" error - false if not

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.DllAlreadyConnected
member.summary: 0x1001 - Client has already been connected

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.DllNotConnected
member.summary: 0x1002 - Client is not yet connected

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.JsonRpcCallFailed
member.summary: 0x1003 - Something else in the process of the JSON RPC call went wrong

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.ResponseIsNull
member.summary: 0x1004 - Response from JSON RPC call is NULL

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.ResponseErrorAndResultNull
member.summary: 0x1005 - Call returned a response with both the .Error and .Result property as NULL

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.ResponseResultIsNotAnArray
member.summary: 0x1006 - Call returned a response, but the .Result property is not a valid JSON array

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.ResponseReturnsToFewArguments
member.summary: 0x1007 - Call returned a response, but the .Result property is not a valid JSON array

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.TooFewArgumentsToCall
member.summary: 0x1007 - API call needs more arguments

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.NoError
member.summary: Indicator for "all OK - no error"

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.JsonRpcParseError
member.summary: JSON RPC 2.0 (-32700 / 0xFFFF8044): Invalid JSON was received by the server. An error occurred on the server while parsing the JSON text.

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.JsonRpcInvalidRequest
member.summary: JSON RPC 2.0 (-32600 / 0xFFFF80A8): The JSON sent is not a valid Request object.

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.JsonRpcMethodNotFound
member.summary: JSON RPC 2.0 (-32601 / 0xFFFF80A7): The method does not exist / is not available.

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.JsonRpcInvalidParams
member.summary: JSON RPC 2.0 (-32602 / 0xFFFF80A6): Invalid method parameter(s).

member.name: F:Attocube.API.Error.ErrorCodes.JsonRpcInternalError
member.summary: JSON RPC 2.0 (-32603 / 0xFFFF80A5): Internal JSON-RPC error.

member.name: M:Attocube.API.AttocubeAPI.Connect(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connect to the target with a hostname or IP address and port provided. If a valid port number (> 0) is supplied, the target URL is constructed like this: http://$(ipAddress):$(port)/api/json If an invalid port number (0 or negative value) is supplied, then the string in "ipAddress" is taken as the literal string for the base service URL (used for e.g. testing)
member.exception: Thrown if the client is already connected
Thrown if the supplied IP address is invalid

member.summary: Disconnect from the target system
member.exception: Thrown if the client is not connected
